children.txt: Mrs Greer is pale, heart rate 115, blood pressure 65 over 100. You hear crackling in the lower lobe of the right lung.
Mrs. Greer`s most recent x-ray shows pneumonia in the lower lobe of the right lung. Oxygen saturation levels are 85%, RBC is low, WBC is high.
Viral pneumonia is less likely than bacterial pneumonia generally in patients of this age.
Asthma is not typically accompanied by high fever. based on her age, bacterial pneumonia is most likely.
Bacterial pneumonia is most common in an otherwise healthy patient of this age.
Mrs. Greer is gravely ill. Your decision is a bad one and would cause harm. Start over.
Blood cell count and oxygen saturation
Mrs Greer is gravely ill. Admitting her is a good idea. Thank you for taking care of the patient!

Mrs. Greer presents to your office  complaining of a deep cough and a high fever.
"Doctor, the coughing is so bad that I can`t sleep. What is wrong with me?"
